Topic.Title: Is there any way to prevent auto scrolling for certain sections?

Posts.EditableText:
Generally speaking, the auto scrolling in Squiffy works well. But there are some instances - where there is lots of text for example -
 where the user is scrolled automatically to the bottom before they have had the chance to read the top.

I'd hope to prevent this in certain instances by using:

    window.scrollTo(0, 0);

But the problem, I think, is that Squiffy executes my Javascript before calling the auto-scroll function. So I still end up at the bottom of the page.

Any ideas?

Posts.EditableText:
Silly me. Squiffy already does this.

It's only in the preview pane that scrolling takes place irrespective of the previous text. Once exported Squiffy won't scroll below top of section text.
